parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (CMF 11240015) at the end.  This strongly suggests an attempt at electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used to identify political advertising.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions "#ElenaLasconi". While it doesn't state her full name or party affiliation, the hashtag clearly refers to a specific individual, likely a candidate in the parliamentary elections.  This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The use of hashtags further amplifies its reach beyond personal communication. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The phrase "Un vot masiv pentru viitor, pentru democrație, pentru România!" ("A massive vote for the future, for democracy, for Romania!") directly encourages voters to support Elena Lasconi. The overall message aims to influence voting behavior, thus fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - c". The use of the word "antidot" (antidote) in relation to voting implies that voting for Elena Lasconi is the solution to a problem, further strengthening the electoral objective.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post lacks any journalistic elements. It doesn't present news, analysis, or opinions in an objective manner. Instead, it directly advocates for a specific candidate.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The message is not a personal opinion; it's a clear call to action, urging voters to support a particular candidate.  The context is explicitly political and electoral.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>560465680034710</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific candidate (Elena Lasconi), targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook post, and has a clear electoral objective: to encourage voters to support her. The presence of a CMF number further strengthens this conclusion.  The post's message is not journalistic or a personal opinion; it's a direct appeal for votes.  The timing of the post (after the official end of the campaign period) is also a crucial factor.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Elena Lasconi</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Teodor Lazăr, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu ID-ul 560465680034710, care promovează candidata Elena Lasconi prin îndemnul explicit la vot masiv,  "Un vot masiv pentru viitor, pentru democrație, pentru România!",  având un efect electoral clar pozitiv asupra acesteia. Postarea, care a beneficiat de o cheltuială de sub 100 RON, a atins între 15.000 și 20.000 de impresii, conform datelor din Ad Library, și a vizat utilizatorii din județul Bacău, cu vârste între 18 și 65 de ani. Prezența numărului CMF 11240015 confirmă natura electorală a postării, demonstrând intenția de a influența votul în favoarea candidatei menționate.  Contactul Teodor Lazăr poate fi stabilit prin email la teodor.lazar@gmail.com sau telefonic la +40740269432.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
